storyInfo: The old tailor learns where his grandson is, and decides to go to the Venezia residence to face Venezia Sr., his former employer. To fulfill her promise to the Signore dei Lupi, Ingrid decides to accompany Umberto and return to the family she left many years ago.

attributes.content: Signora Venezia, did you just say my child was taken away by Venezia wise guys?
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: My informant has no reason to lie to me.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: It's true Luchino went to the port area that night. I heard a car accident happened.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Yes, I was nearby as well.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: I'm guessing the Venezias are involved, and if I'm not wrong, Luchino should have discovered something.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: *sigh*
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Please leave, Signora. I have to close the shop early today.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: You're going to find Venezia Junior yourself?
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: Umberto, I don't know what you used to be like. But I'm sure your age has affected your abilities, even if you were chosen by Vargo back then.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: A sickly old tailor might not even make it past Venezia Junior's doorstep.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: If Luchino really found out about something he shouldn't have, then he might be stuck at the Venezia estate for good.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: I'm old and feeble, Signora Venezia. Even if this hadn't happened, my candle's burning out anyway.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: If there's anything I can't let go right now, it's the boy.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: He's my only relative, and I am his only relative too. He's still so young. Children always leave us with no other choice.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Besides, I'm no stranger to the Venezias.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: I didn't tell you this before—but I used to work for them before you did.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: It's probably why Vargo chose me.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: *sigh* Life goes in a circle, and now I'm going back to where I used to be.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: I'll go with you.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: Signora... this has nothing to do with you at all.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: I'm already very grateful you found a clue to his whereabouts, and came here just to let me know.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: I know you had an unpleasant split with the Venezias because of what happened with Lisa, so if you go back just like that, you'll run into all sorts of trouble.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: You need not worry. I'm doing this because of my agreement with Vargo. Before I find out what truly happened back then, I won't allow anything to happen to you.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: Besides, I understand what sacrifices one would willingly make for the sake of a child.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: Is someone there? Can I leave now?
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: A child?
Did you say something, ragazzino?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Afraid of me?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: May I go home, per favore?
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: I'm afraid I just happen to be here as a guest, so I can't interfere in family matters. Why are they keeping you in here?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: I-I don't know, but if you can't let me go... could you at least contact Umberto de Montano of De Montano Tailor Shop for me?
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: Umberto...
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: He's my nonno. He'll get worried if I'm gone for too long... I have some medicine for him I got from the shop which he really needs, if I c-can't...
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: You're worried about your nonno?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: Follow me. The Venezias always treat their guests right.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: I didn't think I'd meet a friend on this trip.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Lucky for me, I like it when it's lively.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Do I just follow you...? But those people outside...
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: They're also busy catering to me, their guest.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Luchino follows the old man close behind, and they don't run into anyone on their way.
Wh-Who exactly are you, if you don't mind me asking?
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: Stay close, boy. It's a big place, but we're almost there.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Earlier you said you wanted me to tell your nonno about a bunch of things, right?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Sorry, I'm old and my memory's spotty.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: But I think you can tell him yourself.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Umberto, I envy you for having such a loving grandson.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: N-Nonno?
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: Luchino's head is full of questions—Has he interrupted De Montano's business? Was his nonno worried sick about him? How did he know to find him here?
Umberto only casts a glance at Luchino. The old tailor doesn't say a word.
Have a seat.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: I'll decline. My legs aren't as good as they used to. Sitting down is easy, but getting up is quite difficult.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Alright then.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: You said Ingrid came with you... so where is she?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: She left after learning you were the one who found Luchino. She really trusts you.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: ...Alright.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: When did you move out of Montelupe? You left without even a word.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: I just thought there wasn't a need to do so.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Time hasn't been kind to you. The ragazzino told me you're ill?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: It's not serious, though it's bothersome. My eyes and ears don't work so well anymore, my waist, legs, and shoulder joints are always hurting... it's thanks to my work.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Just elderly things. Even carefully maintained quality fabric will inevitably turn stiff and brittle.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Take care of your nonno, boy. Don't leave any regrets.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: I didn't expect to meet you here, and what's happened with the boy... has caused you trouble.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Hardly. I came here for Carnevale, and happened to bump into your grandson here.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Nonno, I—
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: I know, Luchino. Let me handle this.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Antonio should have acted in a more decent manner, and I've sent someone to find him so he can explain himself to you.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Antonio... A terribly common name in Siracusa. But right now, Luchino could only match it to a single face—
Antonio Venezia, the head of Venezia Trucking Co.
...Signor Antonio?
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: I thought this matter would be more troublesome than this, but since you've already stepped in—
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Umberto, you lack the patience of your youth.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Antonio has to explain himself to you, and once that's done, I can also rest easy.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Do you want to meet the owner of this place, boy?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: ...Nonno?
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: There's no way we can possibly refuse, is there?
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Just treat it as a favor to one of your regulars, vecchio amico.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: I was asked before to make a suit for you.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Why don't we make use of our time together here and measure you right now?
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: I hear it's a grand affair, with civilians wearing masks and costumes escorting giant parade cars around the city. I'm sure you'll be there, and need an outfit too.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: I used to remember every regular client's measurements, but as you can see, time shows no mercy to us all. Everyone's changed a lot.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: I've been relying on Luchino more and more to help me write down things I often forget about.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Alright. We have some time to spare before Antonio arrives.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Luchino, I'm afraid we won't be going back so soon. Can you wait a while longer?
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: It's fine, Nonno! Can I help out somehow?
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: Get me my toolbox.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Prepare a file with this gentleman's name on it.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: I'm sorry, signore, I never got your name...
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: Fabrizio Venezia.
The old man writes down his own name, and gives it to Luchino.
Y-you're... But why did you say you were a guest...?
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: Hush, Luchino. Just do as I say without a word from you, and do what we have to do.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Signor Fabrizio is but a client to us right now.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Would you allow this boy to serve you as my assistant, signore? He's been wanting to work on a major client.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Luchino was never allowed to assist his grandfather with important customers in any step of the process before.
But now, Umberto guides him every step of the way, and even encourages the boy to do it himself.
'You must show your clients respect and gratitude', he is told...
Everything goes smoothly and naturally, as if the kidnapping never happened and his nonno hadn't come here to rescue him.
Just working a regular job.
His hands are as stable as yours. Will he become a 'tagliatore' like you?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: A 'tagliatore'?
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: I see you've never told this child about your past, Umberto.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Ingrid, aren't you going in to see Papa?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: So long as the Don is with them, Umberto and Lucchino won't be in any danger.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: I just have to make sure they walk out of here safe and sound.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: You know that's not what I meant.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: You're the one who he needs to see.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: Involve an innocent child in famiglia affairs? I don't remember the old man ever doing something like this.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: He wasn't brought back here on my orders. But I won't deny it—I would have done this anyway if his presence truly poses a threat to the famiglia's interests.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: The famiglia's interests? Or yours?
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: Is there a difference between the two?
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: You've changed quite a lot, Antonio.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: No, you've been away from home for too long, Ingrid.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: This is Siracusa's twenty-third nomadic city. A piece of uncultivated fertile land.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I've sown seeds here, so I'm obliged to ensure they mature for a ripe harvest. No matter the methods used.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: It's also why I've been urging you to come back to us. I know what you're capable of, and we need you here.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Anton, the Don won't like this.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: He'll be mad, of course.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: He just summoned me inside, and I can guess he has a lecture in store.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: But do you think he's angry because I got an innocent boy involved? No, he doesn't care at all.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: He's just angry I wasn't stealthy enough, wasn't proper and 'decent' enough.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: I will prove to him with actual results that the Venezias can establish two sets of order at the same time—one on the table and the other underneath.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: But what we should prioritize is definitely not this so-called 'decency'.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Even if it hurts him, and those who trust you?
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: I love him, I do. He gave me everything I have. I think this is the way I can repay him for that, no matter what it takes.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: And you got one thing wrong, Ingrid. I've never changed.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: ...Never changed—
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: Is that so...?
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: A 'tagliatore'...
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: De Montano Tailor Shop no longer offers that service today. This child doesn't need to know about it.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Pity. I still remember how elegantly you would solve my many problems.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Montelupe's famiglie were all terrified of the elusive 'tagliatore'. One only had to write the target's name down on the order sheet, and he would be reported dead in the newspapers the next day.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: ...It was all to repay your kindness.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: You saved me when I was a young tailor about Luchino's age, and gave me a chance to live in Montelupe.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: You deserve a decent finale, no matter what.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: You've always been so good to me.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Luchino is having a severe headache.
They are indeed, talking about his very own grandfather, but it doesn't seem to match up with the old man right before him.
Right, what happened to his parents? Your son—Luca, right?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Yes. Luca de Montano.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Parents? Luchino seems to have asked Umberto about them before, but the old man always dodged the question.
He had tried to read his grandfather's eyes, but the old man only focused on his work.
Luca was a good boy. A wonderful, sensible child with a talent for tailoring and willingness to bear any hardship.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: He was already a pro in his twenties, and the regulars were all fond of him. I had planned to hand over the shop to him.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Until one day, his body was discovered in a vehicle leaving the city early in the morning.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Next to him was a musical actress, with a little bit of fame in Montelupe, highly coveted by many mafiosi—
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Luchino, your hands are shaking.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: ...Perhaps we should slow down?
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Go fetch our fabric samples. I'll handle it from here.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: ...A-Alright.
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: ...*sigh*
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: You were a little bit cruel to the boy.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: My days are numbered, signore. I can't protect him forever.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Luca's death made me realize something.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: The blood on my hands can never be wiped clean no matter how many times or ways I try. The stench of it will only bring misfortune to me and my family.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: But that boy still fantasized about serving the so-called 'somebodys'. It's my fault.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Be it Signor Antonio, you, or even other famiglie wise guys, Luchino will eventually run into mafiosi.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: He has to know about it.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: You see Luca's death as punishment for your crimes?
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: As a price I paid...
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Raise your head, signore. To measure your neck circumference.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Nonno would sometimes stay at the workbench longer than usual, and his hands would tremble nonstop.
He teased Luchino on multiple occasions the shop would have to close down if Luchino couldn't learn the trade in time.
But now, his grandfather's hands are steadier than he has ever seen.
Luchino watches him pull out the measuring tape. He starts from Venezia Sr.'s shoulders, and then his arms, chest, waist, and legs.
But Luchino knows his nonno's attention has been on him the whole time.
Unfortunately, he is not yet ready to accept the truth.
After losing Luca, I learned about Luchino's existence—Luca had him fostered at a farm out in the countryside.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: And then I found out how Luca had met the actress through a costume order from the theater...
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: ...How he hided a forbidden way of life he gradually built for themselves away from everyone, just to save me from worrying and avoid inciting more trouble...
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: ...How he managed to leave a little speck of hope for themselves, and for me...
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Luchino is all I have left from Luca, and my final wish is for him to live.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: No matter what Signor Antonio or you have planned, I beg you—please don't involve him ever again.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: (Nonno...)
attributes.name: Luchino

attributes.content: Luchino does not know how to react.
The truth of his parents' demise, his nonno's past, his own future... he drowns within his web of emotions.
Please raise your arm.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Signore, I do not ask anything of you.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: I only have a selfish wish to give this child some time, to let him carefully observe how a tailor works.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: How to measure, how to cut cloth, how to respectfully receive clients...
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: And how to stay away from a life he doesn't belong in.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: *sigh* Very well. I see you're set on parting from all your history.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: No need to deliver the suit yourself once you're done. I'll get someone to take it from your sartoria.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Umberto, if you ever feel nostalgic and want to return to Montelupe, make sure to remember il vecchio here too.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: Grazie mille, Signore.
attributes.name: Umberto

attributes.content: So, you have no intentions of letting that ragazzino go...
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: Even if the Don's already agreed to do so.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: Ingrid, even if the kid swears he won't shoot his mouth off, there's no guarantee city hall won't hear about some ridiculous rumors from him.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Many famiglie have their eyes on us. I can't afford the risk.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Papa will understand.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Think about your family too, Ingrid.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: A wolf asked me to fulfill an agreement we made, and I came back to this country for my daughter.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: My anger has long ceased to burn for the famiglia.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: I act only for my own sake now, Anton.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: ...What a shame. Then I'm afraid there's no more room for any discussion.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: You think they can hold me off?
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: No, I just need to make sure that kid keeps his mouth shut.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Anton, answer this question.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: When you bailed me out and said you knew who was the culprit behind Lisa's injury, were you telling the truth?
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: ...Absolutely. I've never lied to you, Ingrid.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: After I sent Lisa away from Siracusa, I investigated the matter myself in secret, and although I found nothing...
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: I always had some suspicions I didn't want to admit was possible. Though, I don't think you'll speak any more on the subject, for now at least.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: ...Forgive me, but I can't tell you anything right now.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: No need. I'll find out eventually.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: The blade falls just above Antonio's nose, but he retains his smile.
Ingrid, you know there are people watching every move we make in this household.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Such indecent behavior from you.
attributes.name: Antonio

attributes.content: Ingrid, please lower your blade, for my sake.
...Don Venezia.
attributes.name: Ingrid

attributes.content: Long time no see, child.
attributes.name: Venezia Sr.
